result.execSummary:
Joshua James Hudson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Joshua James Hudson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua James Hudson

records.addlTxt: Joshua James Hudson, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Adam Thomas Witt. Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant waived extradition proceedings. Copies given to sheriff. Letter sent to Governor along with the waiver.
Preliminary hearing on March 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Violation: Extradition
Issuing Agency: GRSD
NO CONTACT WITH: Anyone under the age of 18.   May not leave state of Wisconsin or Green County without permission of Court.

01:40 PM Joshua James Hudson, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Adam Thomas Witt. Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney.  Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant given extradition complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.   Defendant waives formal reading of complaint. DE is contesting extradition and demanding a governors warrant. Court grants states request of $25,000 cash bail. N.C with anyone under 18 and not to leave the state of Wisconsin. Matter set over. 20CF169 to go along for Plea and sentencing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
